item.title: Error in eConnect: Unable to call remote RPC method
item.description:
This problem resembles previous discussions on DTC and network configurations, as highlighted here and here. DTCPing again proved useful in troubleshooting. The client was using eConnect on a docked laptop with both wireless and wired connections. DTCPing from the client to the server worked, but the server’s DTCPing to the client resulted in a “gethostbyname failure” error. The laptop’s wireless card had an address on a different subnet than the wired connection...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/error-in-econnect-unable-to-call-remote-rpc-method/

item.title: eConnect Error: "The transaction has already been committed or aborted.
item.description:
A client encountered an error (“The transaction has already been implicitly or explicitly committed or aborted.”) with their previously functional eConnect integration after a server migration to a new data center. This error, lacking detailed information, occurs during the eConnect_EntryPoint call when creating a new GL account. Two potential solutions were explored. The first, adding “Enlist=False” to the eConnect connection string, resolved the error but was identified as a workaround that disables transactions and might lead to data corruption...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/econnect-error-the-transaction-has-already-been-committed-or-aborted/
